data.title: Top 50+ Popular Companies that Donate to Nonprofit Organizations
data.meta_description: Amazon, Starbucks, Chevron, Microsoft, and Google are just a few companies that donate millions to nonprofits. Learn more about the top charitable businesses!
data.text:
Google matches up to $10,000 in donations per employee each year.

One of the highlights of Google’s match program is that the company not only matches personal donations to nonprofit organizations, but it also matches money employees personally raise for charitable events that they actively participate in, such as walks, marathons, or bike rides.

Google offers grants to nonprofits where employees volunteer. The company offers low barriers to participation by only requiring employees to volunteer one hour to secure funding.

Nonprofits that use the 360MatchPro Volunteer Hub can provide a search plugin for volunteers to research their eligibility. The platform makes it easy to find forms and guidelines needed to turn volunteer activities into extra funding for worthwhile causes.

Through the Google Ad Grants program, Google supplies eligible nonprofits with $10,000 in free funding to use on its paid advertising platform. Since 2003, Google has donated over $10 billion in free advertising to more than 115,000 nonprofits across 51 different countries.

Applicants undergo an eligibility check and application process. Once approved, they can create ads targeting the search terms their prospects are searching for online. Here’s an example of a Google Ad from Claire’s Place Foundation, which supports people and families affected by Cystic Fibrosis:

Nonprofits can promote any page that supports their mission, helping them to:

Boost donations by amplifying donation forms and specific fundraising campaigns

Attract volunteers by highlighting upcoming opportunities

Promote upcoming events to local audiences

Establish themselves as thought leaders by promoting educational mission-related content

Best of all, the grant automatically renews each month. Given the complexity of routine account maintenance, many organizations partner with expert Google Grants managers to create ads and monitor performance.

We recommend Getting Attention. This agency is a verified Google Partner, meaning Google has vetted them to ensure they’re trustworthy and understand the program. They can walk you through your application, identify the best keywords, create compelling ads, and keep your account in compliance with the program rules. Basically, they’ll handle the heavy lifting, helping you communicate your mission as effectively as possible.

Google for Nonprofits offers free tools designed to streamline nonprofit management and amplify impact. Eligible organizations can access Google Workspace, including professional email addresses at your nonprofit’s domain, 100 TB of storage, and video meetings for up to 100 participants.

Nonprofits can also join the YouTube Nonprofit Program, which provides perks like donation buttons on videos and access to free lessons. If you want to apply for Google Ad Grants, you’ll need a Google for Nonprofits account anyway, so take advantage of all the tools that come with it.

Every Bank of America employee is eligible to request up to $5,000 per year in matching gift funds to nearly any organization.

Bank of America’s matching gift program will match donations made to nonprofit organizations up until March 31st of the following year. That means that your organization has plenty of time to make a last-minute end-of-year appeal or start-of-year appeal to remind your donor base to submit match requests.

Since 1954, GE has been known as one of the top companies that donates to nonprofits.

While GE initially only matched employee donations to colleges and universities, the company has expanded its match program to include nearly all nonprofits.

In early 2024, GE split into 3 companies: GE Aerospace, GE HealthCare, and GE Vernova. All have matching gift opportunities.

While GE Aerospace and GE Vernova employees can have donations ranging from $1 to $5,000 matched, GE Healthcare employees can have donations from $25 to $10,000 matched.

By revenue, BP, a London-based oil and gas company, is the fifth largest company in the world, and they share their wealth accordingly. BP will match donations raised through fundraising up to $5,000 per employee per year.

Their matching gift program and volunteer grant maximums are also $5,000. Through the Fabric of America Fund, BP even allows employees to request up to $300 for their nonprofit of choice without donating or volunteering. BP employees can submit requests for this grant while on the company intranet.

CollectMore is State Street’s matching gift program for fundraising. Through CollectMore, State Street will match their employees’ fulfilled pledges up to $10,000 annually.

CollectMore is part of a three-pronged program for financial giving, which also includes GiveMore, their matching gift program, and DoMore, their volunteer grant program.

Through GiveMore, employees can get up to $10,000 in donations matched per year, senior VPs are eligible for $20,000, executive VPs are eligible for $30,000, and board members, CEO, president, and vice chairs are eligible for up to $40,000. State Street’s DoMore program allows employees to request a $500 grant for every 16 hours they volunteer with a nonprofit.

Chevron is committed to promoting sustainability, whether that’s through more traditional environmental protection efforts or by supporting diversity, economic development, education, health, and human rights. They aim to contribute to the UN Sustainable Development Goals in order to create a more sustainable world by the year 2030.

Through its volunteer program, Chevron helps people across the globe who need access to water, food, and opportunity. They also host Chevron Volunteer Week each year so Chevron employees can volunteer at nonprofits in Richmond and the Bay Area.

Through Starbucks’ Giving Match Program, Starbucks provides grants to nonprofits where U.S. and Canadian employees and retirees volunteer.

Starbucks employees are eligible after volunteering for at least 25 hours with an organization. They can then request a $5 grant for each volunteer hour tracked for up to $1000 total.

Starbucks also has a matching gift component of their Giving Match Program, in which employees can have their donations of $25 to $1,000 matched.

CVS Health employees can apply for Individual Volunteer Challenge Grants, which reward up to 100 hours of volunteering with up to $1,500 according to the following tiers:

15-25 hours = $500 grant

25-100 hours = $1,000 grant

100+ hours = $1,500 grant

CVS Health also offers Team Volunteer Challenge Grants. Teams of five or more who volunteer for more than 50 combined hours can apply for a team volunteer grant of up to $2,500.

There is also a team fundraising match option where CVS Health will match a team’s walk, run, or ride fundraising efforts. They will match up to $5,000 raised or donated per team with a minimum of $500 raised or donated by the team.

CarMax offers volunteer grants of $15 per hour volunteered for a minimum of eight hours. Individuals can earn up to $5,000 in combined matching gift and volunteer grant donations per year for their cause of choice.

Dependents of employees up to the age of 26 are also eligible to participate in the volunteer grant program.

CarMax also encourages CarMax employees to volunteer together through their Volunteer Team-Builders program. For example, employees can earn $500 from CarMax for their cause of choice by hosting a donation drive or volunteering in a group of 5-24 employees.

During IMF’s annual giving campaign, they will match employee donations to most nonprofits.

Employees and retirees can donate directly through payroll deduction or make a one-time payment. The campaign then matches donations at a 1:1 ratio with a maximum of $5,000 per employee.

The campaign begins in October and goes until the end of the calendar year.

Through Target’s corporate giving program, the company gives support for disaster relief and local families in need.

Their Community Engagement Funds allow employees to support local programs and organizations that help families in need. These grants are by invitation only.

Target also allows nonprofits, schools, and government agencies to request a Target GiftCard donation in stores. The average donation is $25-50 with a maximum of $500 per year for each organization.

Office Depot supports a variety of charitable initiatives through its community investment program. One area of focus is providing school supplies for students in need through the Start Proud program.

The company also hosts a Season of Service campaign during the holiday season to support nonprofits with volunteer and philanthropic projects. In the spring, they have a Depot Day of Service that encourages employees and their families and friends to volunteer in their local communities.

Gap matches part- and full-time employees’ donations, as well as those of retirees.

Contributions ranging from $10 to $15,000 are eligible to be matched to most nonprofits at a 1:1 ratio. Gap will match up to $1,000 for part-time employees and up to $15,000 for full-time employees.

Match requests must be made within 120 days of the original donation date.

For every 15 hours a Gap employee volunteers with a nonprofit in a calendar year, the company will provide a $150 grant to the organization.

For every 25 hours a store team of three or more employees volunteers with a nonprofit that serves youth or women, Gap gives a $250 grant to that organization.

Grants of $1,000 to $10,000 are provided to nonprofits where Gap employees sit on the board.

Macy’s matches donations to most nonprofits that full- and part-time employees and retirees make.

Donors who give $25 to $500 are eligible to have their donation matched at a 1:1 ratio.

Matching gift submissions must be sent within one year of the donation date.

Employees must be at the company for 12 months in order to be eligible.

The Coca-Cola Company matches donations of up to $10,000 per year per employee or retiree to most nonprofits.

The minimum donation amount is $25, and contributions are matched at a 2:1 ratio. Coca-Cola will contribute up to $20,000 per employee or retiree each year.

Matching gift requests must be completed and returned to Coca-Cola by February 28th of the year following the initial donation.

Kroger customers can help support nonprofits of their choice by enrolling in Kroger Community Rewards. When members use their Shopper’s Cards, they earn rewards for their organization.

Kroger also uses Kroger Community Rewards to help make organizational fundraising easy by using their Shopper’s Card. Every time members of an organization use their Shopper’s Card, they will earn a rebate. Kroger pays up to $600,000 annually to organizations using the Kroger Community Rewards program; an individual rebate maximum is $24,000 per organization.

The Whole Planet Foundation works to alleviate poverty in the countries where Whole Foods sources its products. Whole Foods has donated over $37 million to the cause since it began in 2005.

Whole Foods also has the Whole Kids Foundation, whose mission is to support schools and help families improve their children’s nutrition. Their KidsGardening Program teaches kids about gardening and the importance of fresh food.

Lastly, Whole Foods also operates the Whole Cities Foundation, which strives to provide nutritious food to underserved communities.
